sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使，使得"之意。
means: make ： 普通用词，指强迫或劝诱他人做某事。
cause ： 正式用词，侧重指使某事发生的原因。
get ： 侧重指劝某人做某事，或指使某事物处于某种状态或产生某种结果。
have ： 普通用词，指让某人做某事。
render ： 书面用词，多指因外界因素而使某人或某物处于某种状态。

sentence.Network_en: The Board had been slow to render its verdict.
sentence.Network_cn: 董事会迟迟未能作出决定。

sentence.Network_en: He had a chance to render some service to his country.
sentence.Network_cn: 他有了一个为国服务的机会。

sentence.Network_en: These tests were so seriously flawed as to render the results meaningless.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些测试存在严重错误，致使结果变得毫无意义。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French rendre, from an alteration of Latin reddere 'give back', from re- 'back' + dare 'give'. The earliest senses were 'recite', 'translate', and 'give back' (hence 'represent' and 'perform'); 'hand over' (hence 'give help' and 'submit for consideration'); 'cause to be'; and 'melt down'

entry.def: You can use render with an adjective that describes a particular state to say that someone or something is changed into that state. For example, if someone or something makes a thing harmless, you can say that they render it harmless.

example.ex: It contained so many errors as to render it worthless.
example.tran: 它错误太多,所以毫无用处。

example.ex: ...barrel-makers whose trade was rendered obsolete by the introduction of stainless steel wine vats.
example.tran: 不锈钢葡萄酒桶的出现使木制酒桶制造者没了生意

entry.def: If you render someone help or service, you help them.

example.ex: He had a chance to render some service to his country...
example.tran: 他有了一个为国服务的机会。

example.ex: Any assistance you can render him will be appreciated...
example.tran: 无论给予他何种帮助，他都会非常感激。

entry.tran: 宣布，作出(判决、决定或回应)
entry.def: When a jury or authority renders a verdict, decision, or response, they announce it.

example.ex: The Board had been slow to render its verdict.
example.tran: 董事会迟迟未能作出决定。

entry.def: To render something in a particular language or in a particular way means to translate it into that language or in that way.

example.ex: ...'Zensho shimasu,' which the translator rendered literally as, 'I will do my best.'...
example.tran: “Zensho shimasu,”译者直译为“我会尽全力”。

example.ex: All the signs and announcements were rendered in English and Spanish.
example.tran: 所有的指示标志和公告都被译成了英语和西班牙语。

entry.def: To render a wall means to cover it with a layer of plaster or cement, usually in order to protect it.

means.word_mean: 1. a substance similar to stucco but exclusively applied to masonry walls

sentences.sentence: "We provided the room with an electrical heater"

means.word_mean: 3. give an interpretation or rendition of;

sentences.sentence: "The pianist rendered the Beethoven sonata beautifully"
"The cow brings in 5 liters of milk"
"This year's crop yielded 1,000 bushels of corn"
"The estate renders some revenue for the family"

means.word_mean: 8. to surrender someone or something to another;

sentences.sentence: "the guard delivered the criminal to the police"

means.word_mean: 9. show in, or as in, a picture;

sentences.sentence: "the face of the child is rendered with much tenderness in this painting"
"render the brick walls in the den"

means.word_mean: 12. restate (words) from one language into another language;

sentences.sentence: "I have to translate when my in-laws from Austria visit the U.S."
"Can you interpret the speech of the visiting dignitaries?"
"She rendered the French poem into English"

means.word_mean: 13. melt (fat, lard, etc.) in order to separate out impurities;

auth_sentence.content: Title and ancestry render a good man more illustrious.
auth_sentence.res_content: Title and ancestry render a good man more illustrious.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Title and ancestry render a good man more illustrious.

auth_sentence.content: Slimane's idea was to render a stage vertically.
auth_sentence.res_content: Slimane's idea was to render a stage vertically.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Slimane's idea was to render a stage vertically.

auth_sentence.content: Express themselves a little as well as render thanks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Express themselves a little as well as render thanks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Express themselves a little as well as render thanks.

stems_affixes.word_buile: sur下面+render给予→把[枪]放下去→投降

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使得,致使;提出,提供,呈报
stems_affixes.word_buile: rend给+er表动词→v.使得,致使;提出,提供,呈报
sur下面+render给予→把[枪]放下去→投降

Sentence.sentence: The boot time is pretty fast, and he navigates through (浏览 ) a few chapters before swiping into a fully rendered 3D molecule that can be spun around to view its various building blocks.
Many professors require that their students use only the latest versions in the classroom, essentially rendering older texts unusable.
To render better service to its users.
It renders us unable to concentrate.

means.word_mean: 呈递; 提供; 开出

sentences.en: She needed him to hear her out and render advice.
sentences.cn: 她需要他把话听完并提出建议。

sentences.en: You will have to render an account of your expenditure.
We are going to render them economic assistance.
sentences.cn: 我们打算向他们提供经济援助。

means.word_mean: 演出; 扮演; 演奏

sentences.en: The piano concerto was wonderfully rendered.
sentences.cn: 这首钢琴协奏曲演奏得很好。

sentences.en: The sentence cannot be literally rendered.
You have rendered a great service to the country.
sentences.cn: 你为国家做了一件大事。

sentences.en: The shock of the discovery rendered him speechless.
sentences.cn: 这一发现使他吃惊得一句话也说不出来。

means.word_mean: 放弃；让与；交出(与 up 连用)

sentences.en: They couldn't resist any more and decided to render up the city.
sentences.cn: 他们无法继续抵抗，决定放弃这座城市。

means.word_mean: 归还；交回(与 back 连用)

sentences.en: The conquered had to render tribute to the conqueror.
sentences.cn: 被征服者只得向征服者称臣纳贡。

means.word_mean: 提供(帮助等)；给予(服务等)

sentences.en: They will call on you to render assistance.
sentences.cn: 他们将到你那里去帮助你。

sentences.en: I can't render my thought accurately.
sentences.cn: 我不能将我的思想准确地表达出来。

sentences.en: Under socialist system rendering to a worker is done according to his work.
sentences.cn: 在社会主义制度下是按劳付酬。

jushi.english: You can render it more freely.
The jury rendered a verdict of no guilt.
jushi.chinese: 陪审团作出了无罪的裁决。
